description: From Middle English untrewe, from Old English untrīewe, from Proto-West Germanic *untriuwī, from Proto-Germanic *untriwwiz. Equivalent to un- +‎ true.

adjectives.description: untrue (comparative more untrue, superlative most untrue)

examples: Synonyms: false, inaccurate, incorrect, unveridical, wrong; see also Thesaurus:false
She says that I stole her necklace, but that's completely untrue.
